intro: Sphalmanthus canaliculatus, commonly known as the narrow-ribbed spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its yellow flowers are clustered in complex structures called cyathia, which are typical of the spurge family. Sphalmanthus canaliculatus is often used in traditional medicine, though its toxic properties require caution in handling.
